alert.note: Alert for Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Huerfano, east central Custer and southwestern Pueblo Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Junkins Burn Scar, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Huerfano, east central Custer and southwestern Pueblo Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
